The Universal Registration Document may be used for the purposes of an offering of securities to the public or the admission of securities for trading on a regulated market if accompanied by a transaction memorandum and, where applicable, a summary and all changes made to the Universal Registration Document.This set of documents is then approved by the AMF in accordance with (EU) ruling 2017/1129. The new team will keep this entrepreneurial culture alive and intensify the transformation currently taking place to make Plastic Omnium a leading player in the clean, connected car. Laurent Favre: Our ACT FOR ALLTM CSR program is not an option but an obligation if we are to continue to conduct QWTDWUKPGUUCPFTGOCKPCNGCFGT6GEJPKECNCPF∆ÅPCPEKCN performance is no longer enough. This program involves all of us to give us the competitive edge that will make all the difference.  145*$0./*6.6/*7&34 -3&(*453 5*0/%0$6.&/5 XXXQMBTUJDPNOJVNDPN INTEGRATED INTE REPORT With the car incorporating an JOINT INTERVIEW increasing number of functions within limited spaces, Plastic Omnium is ideally placed to manage this complexity Laurent Favre How do you see the Group 10 years down the road ? Laurent Favre: We are fortunate to live in exciting times and be able to take part in the most extensive transformation of the automotive industry that has occurred in 50 years. New technologies and services are creating a new type of mobility and an unprecedented user experience. With the car incorporating an increasing number of functions within limited spaces, Plastic Omnium is ideally placed to manage this complexity. The Group is stepping up the transformation of its product lines to support automakers as they move to the sustainable, modular and connected car of the future. F√©licie Burelle: Plastic Omnium has changed so much over VJGRCUVVYQFGECFGUVJCVKVKUFKH∆ÅEWNVVQRTGFKEVGZCEVN[ what it will look like in the 2030 timeframe. As a pure player in the automotive sector, the Group will be incorporating an increasing amount of intelligence in the parts it manufactures to make the car cleaner, safer and more intuitive. We think that the shift from all-thermal to all-electric will be a progressive one. We will therefore continue our two-track CRRTQCEJ∆ÅTUVOCMGVJGTOCNGPIKPGUENGCPGTYJCVGXGT the fuel used; and second, prepare for electric mobility, for YJKEJYGCTGKPXGUVKPIKPJ[FTQIGP6QEQXGTVJKUJWIG∆ÅGNF of sustainable mobility research and capture the best of the new technologies, Plastic Omnium will be reaching out to an increasing number of partners in an open innovation approach. 145*$0./*6.6/*7&34 -3&(*453 5*0/%0$6.&/5  INTEGRATED REPORT PURE PLAYER in the automotive industry and world leader in each of its three business lines An independent French family-owned group created in 1946, Plastic Omnium is a global pure player in the automotive industry, operating 131 plants in 26 countries and with 26 R&D centers. Plastic Omnium is the market leader in its three business lines. Its organization aims to control these. Risk management Compagnie Plastic Omnium SE has set up an organizational and governance framework designed to control the main risks to which the Group is exposed. This framework is supplemented by a worldwide insurance program for its majority-controlled subsidiaries. RISK FACTORS AND CONTROL Main risk factors 2.1 MAIN RISK FACTORS Compagnie Plastic Omnium SE has reviewed the risks that could have a In terms of commitments, all new projects are subject to a highly detailed material adverse effect on its business, financial position, results or approval process. The largest projects must be authorized by Compagnie reputation. In accordance with regulations, only those risks that are both Plastic Omnium SE‚Äôs senior management. Once a project has been significant and specific to Compagnie Plastic Omnium SE, are described accepted, a structured operational and financial monitoring system is set below. up to track it. Risks considered as the most significant, with regard to the probability of occurrence and its impact (after taking into account the mitigation measures implemented by Compagnie Plastic Omnium SE) are identified RISK RELATED TO ACQUISITIONS* by an asterisk. Identification of risk Compagnie Plastic Omnium SE periodically carries out external growth operations through acquisitions that may be of a significant size across OPERATIONAL RISKS the Group. These acquisitions are decided on the basis of assumptions, notably, objectives relating to synergies and future results, which may not be RISK RELATED TO AUTOMOTIVE PROGRAMS* achieved in the timescales or to the extent initially expected. In particular, Compagnie Plastic Omnium SE could encounter difficulties Identification of risk integrating the companies acquired, their technologies, product ranges Each automotive program has risks which could reduce its profitability and employees. It may also be unable to retain or develop strategic clients from that initially expected. The risk relates particularly to programs that of the acquired companies. incorporate product innovations or which implement new industrial processes. This risk is increased for programs whose launch coincides Risk management with the start of a new plant. These uncertainties may require Compagnie Plastic Omnium SE to make higher levels of investment or expenditure Compagnie Plastic Omnium SE takes great care to put resources in place than initially forecast in order to reach the rates and quality levels dedicated to integrating acquired companies and sets detailed objectives required by the customer. for these, broken down into action plans. Particular care is taken to ensure the swift implementation of Plastic Omnium‚Äôs systems in acquired In addition, each automotive program is subject to risks in terms of entities, in order to effectively manage these action plans and measure manufacturing volumes, which depend on a wide range of factors, some the achievement of objectives. of which are regional in nature, such as economic activity, carmaker production strategy, consumer access to credit and the regulatory environment, but also on factors specific to each vehicle, such as the attractiveness of its design. INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY RISK Ultimately, every automotive program is exposed to the risk of disruption Identification of risk of carmaker‚Äôs demand, of variable duration. This disruption can result The day-to-day activity of Compagnie Plastic Omnium SE‚Äôs operational from hazards specific to the carmaker (fire or natural disaster impacting functions (Research and Development, Production, Purchasing, Logistics, one of its plants, work stoppage at a plant due to a strike, a pandemic, Commercial) and support functions Finance, Human Resources, Legal) is etc.). This disruption can also result from a similar hazard that would highly dependent on the smooth running of the information systems used impact a supplier of components used in the manufacture of a vehicle, in these functions. This activity could be affected by the unavailability of which could thus force the carmaker to permanently stop its production critical information systems, mainly due to system breakdown, line for lack of components. communication networks failure, damage to infrastructure or malicious actions carried out internally or externally.
